message:
Here's an example of my slim content_for call in index.html.slim:

=content_for :title do
	title The Middleman!

Am I missing something obvious?

I'm using slim for my layout and templates and every time I set a content_for block, it generates this in my page [#<Proc:0x007f84f4882810@/Users/kevinhale/Sites/rbg/source/index.html.slim:1>] where I'm calling it.
Don't use the = sign, use -, otherwise it will try to print the response. You use = on the yield_content  command later, because it's actually supposed to output something.
Man...it was obvious. :( Anyway, thanks for the quick response. This is my first encounter with Ruby and so I really appreciate the patience and help. Hopefully, I should be good from here on out.
